text: Devi Sri Prasad (born 2 August 1979) is an Indian music composer, lyricist, singer, and performer. He is best known for his works in Telugu and Tamil films. DSP is a recipient of nine Filmfare Awards, eight of which are Filmfare Best Music Director South Awards and one Filmfare South Best Background Music, five CineMAA Awards - Best Music Director, and one Nandi Award for Best Music Director. Devi also choreographed a song in the 2015 film Kumari 21F. As of 2020, he has composed music for more than 100 films in various Indian languages. == Personal life and career == Devi Sri Prasad was born as : Gandham Sriprasad, in Vedurupaka, Andhra Pradesh into a Telugu speaking family. His father Gandham Satyamurthy was a writer in Telugu cinema who has penned popular films like Devatha, Khaidi No. 786, and Pedarayudu. He grew up in Madras (now Chennai) and attended M. Venkata Subba Rao School in T. Nagar. In his debut music album Dance Party, he collaborated with veteran singer SP Balasubrahmanyam’s son S. P. Charan. He debuted in the 1999 Telugu film Devi as a film music composer. Contrary to popular belief that 'Devi' was prefixed to his name after his debut film, he was named after his maternal grandparents, Devi Meenakshi, and Prasada Rao. He has one younger sister and one younger brother : Gandham Sagar who is a playback singer.
